name: Radianstuff
tagline: numbers that twirl leaving wool in their wake
body:
### What is this about???
It's a program that makes wool from numbers!
![](https://scontent-a-nrt.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpf1/t31.0-8/1277730_10204491448111983_6713740770755801034_o.jpg?dl=1)


### Instructions
**Click** to set a number spinning off in a random direction.
The number is weakly attracted to the pointer. If you click a lot you can develop a wonderful bouquet of numbers that leave wooly trails.  The rotation speed is roughly set at the number displayed, in degrees per second.

**Press R** to switch the rotation units between _radians per second_ and _degrees per second_.

### Authors and Contributors
Originated as a demo of some object-oriented stuff by Tristan Miller (@tristanmiller) in 2014. The idea was developed further in a late-night pro-jam in Hackney Wick with Leo and Nick.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
